MIME element (text/plain) 
David K. Caplan 
Keats McFarland & Wilson LLP 
9720 Wilshire Blvd., Penthouse Suite 
Beverly Hills, CA 90212 
Tel: (310) 248-3830 
Fax: (310) 860-0363 
 
April 23, 2007 
 
VIA ELECTRONIC MAIL 
 
Jimmy Hopkins 
217 B west 20th Street 
Higginsville, MO 64037 
 
xinja2003@yahoo.com; wartog@miimovies.net; abuse@theplanet.com   
         
        Re: Unauthorized Use of Paramount Pictures Corporation 
Properties 
        http://www.miimovies.net 
 
To Whom It May Concern: 
 
      This letter is being written to you on behalf of Paramount 
Pictures Corporation ("Paramount"). Paramount is the owner of rights in 
and to the Disturbia motion picture (hereinafter referred to as 
"Disturbia"). No one is authorized to copy, reproduce, distribute, or 
otherwise use Disturbia without the express written permission of 
Paramount. 
 
        It has come to our attention that the website located at 
"http://www.miimovies.net/ok/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=683," for which you 
are the service provider, is reproducing and distributing Disturbia. 
 
      Paramount has the good faith belief that the use of the material 
in the manner complained of is not authorized by Paramount, its agent or

the law. Paramount diligently enforces its rights in and to Disturbia in

all forms of media. Our client rightfully takes its responsibility for 
the protection of Disturbia very seriously. 
 
      In accordance with the DMCA, we request your assistance in the 
removal of infringements of Disturbia from this website and any other 
sites for which you act as an Internet Service Provider. We further 
declare under penalty of perjury that we are authorized to act on behalf

of Paramount and that the information in this letter is accurate. 
 
      Nothing contained in this letter constitutes an express or implied

waiver of any rights, remedies, or defenses of Paramount, all of which 
are expressly reserved. 
 
                       Very truly yours, 
                            /s/ 
                       David K. Caplan 
                  Keats McFarland & Wilson LLP
